text: Charles-Louis-Étienne Nuitter (24 April 1828 - 23 February 1899) was a French librettist, translator, and librarian. He is best remembered for having written the libretto for the ballet, Coppélia and for having helped translate Richard Wagner's earliest operas into French. Category:1828 births Category:1899 deaths Category:French translators Category:Librettists Category:Librarians
title: Charles-Louis-Étienne Nuitter
